25.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
25.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

25.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
25.str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.

25.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
25.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

26.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
26.str2: To make known, declare, know, discover. From a derivative of ginosko; to make known; subjectively, to know.

26.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
26.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.

26.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
26.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

26.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
26.str2: To make known, declare, know, discover. From a derivative of ginosko; to make known; subjectively, to know.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

26.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
26.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

26.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
26.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

26.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
26.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

26.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
26.str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
